item.create_new_age.wire.message.self_co: You cannot connect a connector to itself
item.create_new_age.wire.message.too_far: Too far away! Maximum wire length is %d blocks
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_1: You can use a Heating Plate to generate heat during daytime.
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_2: Heat pipes can be used to spread heat around.
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_12: When provided with heat from below a Stirling Engine will start to slowly rotate.
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_13: If a Stirling Engine is provided with more heat it will rotate a bit less slowly.
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_14: You can use a heat pump to pump heat forward!
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_15: However be careful, if a block overheats, it will turn into lava.
create_new_age.ponder.heater.text_1: The Boiler Heater acts the same way as a blaze burner, however it uses heat instead of burnable fuel.
create_new_age.ponder.heater.text_2: The more heat you provide to it, the more heat it will release.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_1: A nuclear reactor is a great way to generate large amounts of heat.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_2: The first component of a nuclear reactor are the Reactor Rods, which allow for nuclear reaction to take place.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_3: The second component is the Reactor Fuel Inserter which allows you to insert fuel into the reactor.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_4: The final component needed for a nuclear reactor is the Reactor Heat Vent which will collect heat from the reactor and distribute it to connected pipes.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_5: However as one uses the nuclear reactor they must be careful as the nuclear reactor emits deadly radiation.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_6: One can avoid radiation by wearing leather armor or by completely encasing the nuclear reactor in Reactor Casing/Glass.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_7: Additionally you must have something use the heat from the reactor, otherwise you will get a fun little meltdown.
create_new_age.ponder.energiser.text_1: When provided with electricity and rotation, the Energizer will energize items in depots and on belts under it.
create_new_age.ponder.wires.text_1: Wires are used to transfer energy from one place to another
create_new_age.ponder.wires.text_2: This block automatically pushes its energy to neighboring blocks. But what if it didn't do that?
create_new_age.ponder.wires.text_3: Connector can pull energy from the block it stands on when 'Pull' mode is enabled. Modes are switched with a wrench
create_new_age.ponder.wires.text_4: Note that 'Pull' mode is only for compatibility with other mods and can't be used to extract energy from energizer/motor internal storage
create_new_age.ponder.generation.text_1: When rotated Generator Coils will generate electricity as long as they are surrounded by magnets.
create_new_age.ponder.generation.text_2: The electricity generated by coils can be collected using the Carbon Brushes block.
create_new_age.ponder.generation.text_3: As the magnetic force of magnets around the Generator Coils increases, the percentage of SU being turned into electricity increases.
create_new_age.ponder.generation.text_6: However, as the efficiency increases, the amount of SU used by the Generator Coils increases.
create_new_age.ponder.motor.text_1: Motors allow you to generate rotation using electricity.
create_new_age.ponder.motor.text_2: You can configure its speed using a wrench, however the amount of SU it outputs will stay the same.
create_new_age.ponder.motor.text_3: By powering it with redstone you can disable it.
create_new_age.ponder.motor.text_4: You can also invert that mechanic by right-clicking on it.
create_new_age.ponder.motor_extension.te: Tired of your motors being overstressed? Use a motor extension!
Extensions allow you to configure motor stress capacity multiplier
Note that energy consumption is proportional to stress capacity
create_new_age.ponder.tag.electrical.des: Blocks responsible for generating, transporting and using electricity.
create_new_age.ponder.tag.heating.descri: Blocks used for generating, transporting and using heat.
create_new_age.ponder.tag.reactor.descri: Blocks used in a nuclear reactor.
create.tooltip.create_new_age.battery_is: _Battery controller_ must be located at the top of a _fluid tank_ filled with _electrolyte_.
create_new_age.ponder.generation.text_7: Note: GENERATOR COILS DO NOT GENERATE ROTATION, ONLY ELECTRICITY.
